Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Contorted \Con*tort"ed\, a. 1. Twisted, or twisted together. ``A contorted chain of icicles.'' --Massinger. [1913 Webster]
2. (Bot.) (a) Twisted back upon itself, as some parts of plants. (b) Arranged so as to overlap each other; as, petals in contorted or convolute [ae]stivation. [1913 Webster]

contorted adj 1: twisted (especially as in pain or struggle); "his mad contorted smile"; "writhed lips"; "my writhen features"- Walter scott [syn: {writhed}, {writhen}] 2: strained or wrenched out of normal shape; "old trees with contorted branches"; "scorched and distorted fragments of steel"; "trapped under twisted steel girders" [syn: {distorted}, {twisted}]
